author: Special Correspondent
text:
A city court on Tuesday rejected the bail petition of two suspects — Shahnawaj Khan alias Shanu and Jaan-e-Alam alias Jhonny — in the hit-and-run case in which an IAF man lost his life last week.

While Shahnawaj Khan alias Shanu was arrested on Monday from Delhi, Jhonny Noor Alam was arrested early Tuesday from Kolkata.

Counsel of both suspects said that the police had accused former RJD MLA Mohammed Sohrab’s younger son Sambia Sohrab of driving the vehicle. Then why have others been implicated in this case, they asked.

However, public prosecutor argued that investigation in the case was at an early stage and custody of the accused was necessary.

Dismissing their bail plea, Chief Metropolitan Magistrate Sanjay Ranjan Pal remanded them in police custody till January 30.

The police charged the suspects under sections 302 [murder], 120 (b) [criminal conspiracy] 304 [attempt to murder] 427 [mischief causing damage] and 201 [causing disappearance of evidence].
title: Court refuses bail for two suspects in Kolkata hit-and-run case
